```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```


```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggridges)
```

```{r setup, CACHE=TRUE}
library(rnoaa)
weather_df = 
  rnoaa::meteo_pull_monitors(c("USW00094728", "USC00519397", "USS0023B17S"),
                      var = c("PRCP", "TMIN", "TMAX"), 
                      date_min = "2017-01-01",
                      date_max = "2017-12-31") %>%
  mutate(
    name = recode(id, USW00094728 = "CentralPark_NY", 
                      USC00519397 = "Waikiki_HA",
                      USS0023B17S = "Waterhole_WA"),
    tmin = tmin / 10,
    tmax = tmax / 10) %>%
  select(name, id, everything())
weather_df
```

## Start a plot 

```{r}
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmin, y = tmax))
```

Scatteplot 
```{r}
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point()
```

```{r}
weather_df %>% 
  filter(name == "CentralPark_NY") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point()
```


## In class
```{r}
weather_sp = 
  ggplot(weather_df,es(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point()
```


## Board 
```{r}
plot_weather = 
  weather_df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) 

plot_weather + geom_point()

```

## More Plot Options 
Add an aesthetic 
```{r}
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = name))
```

Add a geom
```{r}

##Adds a smooth line through your data points, adding se 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = .5) +
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE)
```


```{r}
## makes it a little easier to see by changing the alpha from .5 to .4 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = .4) +
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE)
```

```{r}
##Aethetics map is for creating a smooth through each color 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmin, y = tmax, color = name)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = .4) +
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE)
```

Facetting...
```{r}
## Divide your plot against a nother vairable 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmin, y = tmax, color = name)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = .4) +
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE) + 
  facet_grid( ~ name)
```

A more interesting plot
```{r}
## Boring one...
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = date, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point()

## Adding color
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = date, y = tmax, color = name)) + 
  geom_point()

## Smooth, often not enough data to show and would not use 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = date, y = tmax, color = name)) + 
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE) 

## Hexagon
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmax, y = tmin)) + 
  geom_hex()
```

```{r}
## Allows you to do it by adding precipitation(?)
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = date, y = tmax, color = name, size = prcp)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE) + 
  facet_grid(~name)
```


## Learning Assessment 
```{r}
## Color is set to be blue outside of the aesthetic
ggplot(weather_df) + geom_point(aes(x = tmax, y = tmin), color = "blue")

## ggplot is looking for a variable that is blue and will color whichever 
ggplot(weather_df) + geom_point(aes(x = tmax, y = tmin, color = "blue"))
```

## Univariate Plots

Histogram
```{r}

##you don't need to identify y because it is a freq, but will need to identify x axis 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmax)) + 
  geom_histogram()
```

```{r}
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmax)) + 
  geom_histogram()
  facet_grid(~name)
```

```{r}
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmax, fill = name)) + 
  geom_histogram(position = "dodge", binwidth = 2)
```

Density Plot - a smooth histogram
```{r}
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmax, fill = name)) + 
  geom_density(alpha = .4, adjust = .5, color = "blue")
```

Boxplot 

```{r}
##without name 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(y = tmax)) + 
  geom_boxplot()
```

```{r}

## with name 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = name, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_boxplot()
```

Violin Plot 

```{r}

## without color 

## with color 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = name, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_violin(aes(fill = name), color = "blue", alpha = .5) + 
  stat_summary(fun.y = median, geom = "point", color = "blue", size = 4)
```

```{r}

## in class
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmax, y = name)) + 
  geom_density_ridges()

## Website 
ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmax, y = name)) + 
  geom_density_ridges(scale = .85)
```

```{r}
weather_plot = ggplot(weather_df, aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = .5) 

ggsave("weather_plot.pdf", weather_plot, width = 8, height = 5)
```
